description:
Allows for moving objects through the scene on bézier curves.
Append one or more path elements to the object, and then play them with the start action.
name: CurvedMovement

eventsFunctions.description: Interpolate a curve at a specified progress.
eventsFunctions.name: InterpolateCurve

events.comment: Apply the easing to the progress.

The online formula used:

((1 - PR) * (1 - PR) * (1 - PR)) * S1 + 3 * ((1 - PR) * (1 - PR)) * PR * S2 + 3 * (1 - PR) * (PR * PR) * E2 + (PR * PR * PR) * E1

PR = Progress
S1 = Start point
S2 = Start control point
E1 = End point
E2 = End control point

parameters: ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * GetArgumentAsNumber("Start") + 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControl") + 3 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControl") + (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * GetArgumentAsNumber("End")

eventsFunctions.description: Angle of a curve at a specified progress.
eventsFunctions.name: CurveAngle

events.comment: Apply the easing to the progress.

The online formula used:

3 * ((1 - PR) * (1 - PR)) * (S2 - S1) + 6 * (1 - PR) * PR * (E2 - S2) + 3 * (PR * PR) * (E1 - E2)
AngleBetweenPositions(0, 0, AngleX, AngleY)

PR = Progress
S1 = Start point
S2 = Start control point
E1 = End point
E2 = End control point

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(0, 0, 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlX") - GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX")) + 6 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlX") - GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlX")) + 3 * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX") - GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlX")), 3 * ((1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1))) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlY") - GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY")) + 6 * (1 - Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlY") - GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlY")) + 3 * (Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1) * Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp1)) * (GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY") - GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlY")))

eventsFunctions.description: Visualise a movement curve by creating a specified number of objects on the curve.
eventsFunctions.name: VisualiseCurve
eventsFunctions.sentence: Visualise a movement curve by creating _PARAM2_ _PARAM1_s on _PARAM3_ layer from _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ to _PARAM6_;_PARAM7_ (first control point: _PARAM8_;_PARAM9_, second control point: _PARAM10_;_PARAM11_) with _PARAM12_ easing

events.comment: Set Temp2 to 0. The reason I'm not using Temp1 is because it is already used by InterpolateCurve.

Create and rotate objects using the InterpolateCurve and CurveAngle.
The progress is: Temp2 / ObjectAmountParameter

parameters: CurvedMovement::InterpolateCurve(GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlX"), GetArgumentAsString("Easing"), Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp2) / GetArgumentAsNumber("ObjectAmount"))

CurvedMovement::InterpolateCurve(GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlY"), GetArgumentAsString("Easing"), Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp2) / GetArgumentAsNumber("ObjectAmount"))

CurvedMovement::CurveAngle(GetArgumentAsNumber("StartX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("StartY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("EndX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("EndY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("FirstControlY"), GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlX"), GetArgumentAsNumber("SecondControlY"), GetArgumentAsString("Easing"), Variable(__CurvedMovement.Temp2) / GetArgumentAsNumber("ObjectAmount"))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows moving the object on bézier curves.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CurvedMovement

events.comment:
Yes. This action is somehow required.
If I don't use easing before calling an expression that does use easing, the world explodes.

When starting on a new path element, change StartX and StartY to the X and Y position of the object.
Disable StartMove and Finished to disable starting a new movement and disable IsFinished activating.

Timer variable. I can't use a normal timer because (afaik) it isn't possible to set a timer to a specific value (which I need to do with the ChangeProgress action).
Also multiply the added value by SpeedScale.
Change position with InterpolateCurve.

Change angle with CurveAngle.
Also apply any rotation offset at the end.

If ElapsedTime is above the current path element's Duration, finish the path element.
Set StartMove and Finished to true to start a new movement and indicate that a path element is finished.

Subtract the Duration value from the ElapsedTime.
This makes the movement smoother between two paths unlike if I were to reset ElapsedTime to 0.
If there are no more paths left in Move, set the object's position to the destinations to avoid any float calculation errors.
Remove the current path element.

eventsFunctions.description: Append a path element to the end of an object's path.
eventsFunctions.name: Append
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Append a path element to _PARAM0_: To _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ (first control point: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, second control point: _PARAM6_;_PARAM7_) in _PARAM8_ seconds, with _PARAM9_ easing

events.comment: Append a new variable to the end of PathElements.

Set all the numbers and strings for the last PathElements.
PathElements is being referenced as a structure here, so the value 0 is removed, and the variable transforms into a structure (or at least something similar happens).

eventsFunctions.description:
Move an object on the next specified number of path elements.
If the object is already moving, replace the old movement.
eventsFunctions.name: Start
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Move _PARAM0_ on the next _PARAM2_ path elements

events.comment: Clear all of Move, so a new movement can start.
Append a new variable to the end of Move.
Change Temp1 to 1. This will be used to know how many variables have been copied over yet

Copy all numbers and strings from PathElements to Move.
Move is being referenced as a structure here, so the value 0 is removed, and the variable transforms into a structure (or at least something similar happens).
Add 1 to Temp1, so new values can be copied over.
If DeleteElements is set to true, delete all the used elements from PathElements.
Set ElapsedTime to 0.
Start a new movement.

eventsFunctions.description: Draw debug lines of a path of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: Debug

events.comment: First (three gray) lines
Middle (two green) lines
Last (one blue) line
The curve
Starting and ending circles
Control point circles

parameters.longDescription: This object will be used to display the debug lines.
parameters.name: ShapePainter

eventsFunctions.description: Remove the last path element of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: Remove
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Remove the last path element of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Clear all paths elements of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: Clear

eventsFunctions.description: Change the speed scale of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetSpeedScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ Change the speed scale of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

parameters.longDescription:
1: Default.
2: Two times faster.
0.5: Two times slower.
parameters.name: Scale

eventsFunctions.description: Change the progress of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: SetProgress

events.comment: ProgressParameter * Duration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the progress of an object is above a specified value.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckProgress

events.comment: ProgressParameter ≤ (ElapsedTime / Duration)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a path element of an object is finished.
eventsFunctions.name: PathIsFinished
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ A path element of _PARAM0_ is finished

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the movement of an object is finished.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveIsFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Progress of an object. Returns a number from 0 to 1.
eventsFunctions.name: Progress

eventsFunctions.description: Number of path elements of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: Elements

propertyDescriptors.label: Delete any path elements when using them
propertyDescriptors.name: DeleteElements
